Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game

Class DominionDecompositionSolver

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractControllableAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.AbstractControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.DominionDecompositionSolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, ControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>, ControllableAlgorithm
public class DominionDecompositionSolver
extends AbstractControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
This class provides an implementation of the subexponential algorithm for solving parity games (min-even) [Marcin Jurdzinski, Mike Paterson, Uri Zwick: A Deterministic Subexponential Algorithm for Solving Parity Games. SIAM Journal on Computing. 38(4): 1519-1532 (2008)]. Note that the parity condition in the paper is max-even while the parity condition in GOAL is min-even
Author:
Yu-Shiang Hwang, Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • isApplicable

      public boolean isApplicable​(Game g)
      Description copied from interface: GameSolver
      Returns true if the specified game is supported by this solver.
      Parameters:
      g - a game
      Returns:

    • getDominion

      public DominionDecompositionSolver.Dominion getDominion​(Game game, StateSet subgame, int l)
      Returns the dominion of a subgame. The size of the dominion is limited by a specified size.
      Parameters:
      game - a game
      subgame - the states of the subgame in game
      l - the maximum size of the returned dominion
      Returns:
      the dominion of the subgame, or null if there is no such dominion

    • newWin

      public MemorylessSolution newWin​(Game game, StateSet subgame)
      This method implements the new-win procedure in Figure 7.1 in [JPZ08].
      Parameters:
      game - a game
      subgame - the states of the subgame
      Returns:
      a solution of the subgame

    • oldWin

      public MemorylessSolution oldWin​(Game game, StateSet subgame)
      This method implements the old-win procedure in Figure 7.1 in [JPZ08] but the parity condition is min-even.
      Parameters:
      game - a game
      subgame - the states of the subgame
      Returns:
      a solution of the subgame

    • solve

      public MemorylessSolution solve​(Game game, StateSet subgame) throws UnsupportedException
      Description copied from interface: GameSolver
      Returns a solution of a subgame of a specified game.
      Parameters:
      game - a game
      subgame - the states of the subgame in the game
      Returns:
      a solution of the specified game
      Throws:
      UnsupportedException - if the game is not supported by this solver
